titles.title: Child Abuse Accountability Act
Child Abuse Accountability Act
Child Abuse Accountability Act

To amend title 5, United States Code, to permit the garnishment of an annuity under the Civil Service Retirement System or the Federal employees' Retirement System, if necessary to satisfy a judgment against an annuitant for physically abusing a child.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E3031)

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits.

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).

action.text: Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits Discharged.

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service. H. Rept. 103-721.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 398.

action.text: Ms. Norton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 9/19/1994--Passed House amended. Child Abuse Accountability Act - Amends Federal law regarding Federal employees' pensions to provide for the garnishment of retirement annuities of Federal employees for the enforcement of a court order for the payment of monetary damages to victims of emotional, sexual, or physical child abuse.
